programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Five Steaks and an Eggplant
programme.desc: Chandler receives a sexy phone call meant for someone else; the gang becomes divided along income lines. Jade: Brittney Powell. Waiter: Spencer Cherashore. Monica: Courteney Cox. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Lesbian Wedding
programme.desc: Rachel's mother (Marlo Thomas) considers ending her marriage; Carol decides to marry her lover, Susan; Phoebe believes she's possessed. Newt Gingrich's sister Candace has a cameo as a minister. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Finds Out
programme.desc: Rachel goes on a date in an effort to forget about Ross; Monica presses Chandler to complete an exercise program. Michael: Arye Gross. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston. Monica: Courteney Cox. Ross: David Schwimmer. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel dates a guy who's similar to Ross; Joey can get a part if he sleeps with the casting director; Fun Bobby is no fun without alcohol. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After the Super Bowl
programme.desc: Part 1 of two. Ross searches for Marcel; Joey is attracted to an obsessed fan (Brooke Shields); Phoebe sings songs for kids. Rob: Chris Isaak. Zookeeper: Dan Castellaneta. Mr. Lipson: Fred Willard. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After the Super Bowl
programme.desc: Conclusion. Ross learns Marcel is working on a movie, and the film's makeup artist seems to want Chandler; Monica and Rachel fight over Jean-Claude Van Damme, who appears as himself. Susie: Julia Roberts. (repeat).

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Charlie and Jake compete to win the affection of a waitress; Alan senses sexual tension between him and his receptionist. Shelly: Carol Kane. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Judith is pregnant, and Alan suspects he's the father. Meanwhile, Jake is in a foul mood. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.sub-title: George Searches for a Needle in a Haight-Stack
programme.desc: Chingy and Carrot Top appear as George gets a lead on Carmen's location from the guy who took her there. Zack: Trevor Wright. Vic: Emiliano Diez. Mel: Mark Tymchyshyn. Bouncer: Marcus Brown. Carmen: Masiela Lusha. Benny: Belita Moreno. Max: Luis Armand Garcia. (repeat).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: Carmen's insistence on being treated like an adult prompts George to charge her rent. So she takes in a roommate. Taylor: Valeria Andrews. Carmen: Masiela Lusha. Angie: Constance Marie. Max: Luis Armand Garcia. (repeat).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: After forgetting their anniversary, George wants to buy Angie a ring he couldn't afford before, but the one she chooses is still beyond his means. Salesman: Ian Gomez. Vic: Emiliano Diez. Angie: Constance Marie. Benny: Belita Moreno. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: Angie decides to home school Carmen after her private school rejects her and Angie's employer goes under. Janet: Kaitlin Olson. Carmen: Masiela Lusha. Angie: Constance Marie. Ernie: Valente Rodriguez. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: George interviews for a job in Colorado, but lies that it's just a vacation to the kids, who find their new environment not so different from L.A. Ed: George Wendt. Winnie: Marietta Deprima. Li'l Bit: Skye McCole Bartusiak. Tom: Kyle Searles. Vic: Emiliano Diez. Carmen: Masiela Lusha. Angie: Constance Marie. Max: Luis Armand Garcia. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: In Colorado, George pushes the kids to enjoy their new freedom, but their old activities set town tongues wagging. Winnie: Marietta Deprima. Ed: George Wendt. Li'l Bit: Skye McCole Bartusiak. Tom: Kyle Searles. Vic: Emiliano Diez. Benny: Belita Moreno. Carmen: Masiela Lusha. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry gets inspired by Olympic underdog Eddie "the Eagle" Edwards, while Beverly decides that the latest furniture craze is the answer to slumping sales at Murray's store. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: It's the nerds vs. the jocks, with Adam as the latter's leader, playing Dungeons and Dragons. Meanwhile, Erica makes a decision about the college she wants to attend, but neither Beverly nor Murray are on board. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Mr. Krabs wants SpongeBob and Patrick to become wrestlers so he can make money managing them; SpongeBob buys tons of trading cards, hoping to get the rare card he covets. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: There's no room for Squidward in SpongeBob and Patrick's new clubhouse; a homeless sea horse wreaks havoc at the Krusty Krab. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save Alex's Mini-Patrol; Pups Save a Lost Tooth
programme.desc: A mini Paw Patrol is formed by Alex, who enlists Chickaletta, Cali, Turtle and Bunny to join him; Alex's tooth falls out, and then he misplaces it, so the gang must find it before the tooth fairy arrives. (repeat).

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: Captain Daddy Pig; The Power Cut; Bouncy Ball; Stars; Daddy Pig's Birthday
programme.desc: Peppa and her family go boating on a river; Peppa and George get creative during a power outage; Peppa and Suzy play tennis; Peppa's family goes stargazing at night; Daddy Pig is greeted with a birthday surprise when he gets home from work. (repeat).

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: Grampy Rabbit in Space; Pirate Treasure George's Racing Car; George's Balloon; Pedro Is Late
programme.desc: Grampy Rabbit loses his voice; Peppa buries a treasure; Grandpa Pig builds a race car for George; George struggles to hold a large balloon; Pedro Pony is missing when the gang get ready to go to a museum. (repeat).

programme.title: Top Wing
programme.sub-title: Shirley's Sleep-Over Adventure; A Little Off Track
programme.desc: A falling tree threatens Shirley's home, so the Cadets invite her to sleep over, and she helps guide their rescue; Betty McBat challenges Rod to see who is faster. When Baddy tries to cheat, Rod has to rescue Betty. (repeat).

programme.title: Bubble Guppies
programme.desc: Mr. Grouper catches a cold, so the kids combat germs by practicing good hygiene. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bubble Guppies
programme.desc: A steam locomotive enters a train race, but a herd of cows on the tracks threatens to derail its chances of winning. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save a Blimp; Pups Save a Chili Cook-Out
programme.desc: In the fourth-season opener, a weather blimp is stolen by Mayor Humdinger, who wants to use it to alter Foggy Bottom's weather. Later, Mr. Porter's stove explodes prior to the big chili cook-off. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Sea Patrol: Pirate Pups to the Rescue
programme.desc: Carlos and Tracker get stranded on an island while searching for buried treasure. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save the Penguins; Pups Save a Dolphin Pup
programme.desc: Penguins swipe some fish off of Cap'n Turbot's boat, so the gang try to catch the birds and send them back to the South Pole; a baby dolphin gets stranded in shallow water and needs to be reunited with its parents. (repeat).

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Blaze goes on a treasure hunt with AJ, Gabby and Pegwheel the Pirate-Truck. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Baby dinosaurs run amok in Adventure Bay after the gang find three fossilized dinosaur eggs. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Great Race; Pups Take the Cake
programme.desc: The pups race each other all across the town to see which is the fastest; Mr. Porter enters a cake competition, and he needs Ryder and the pups to help him bake the biggest and tastiest cake. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save Luke Stars; Pups Save Chicken Day
programme.desc: Ryder and Marshall go to rescue Luke Stars; Paw Patrol search for Chicklatta and try to save the festivities. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save a Floundering Francois; Pups Save the Pop-Up Penguins
programme.desc: The Flounder starts to sink and Francois goes overboard during a violent storm; penguins arrive in town after stowing away on a ship, and the rescue team must gather them and send them home before they get too warm. (repeat).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.sub-title: Money Talks; SpongeBob vs. the Patty Gadget; Slimy Dancing
programme.desc: Mr. Krabs' wish that his money could talk is granted, and it tells him how it wants to be spent; SpongeBob pits his skills against a patty-making machine; SpongeBob trains for the Bikini Bottom dance contest with Squidward's help. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.sub-title: Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy IV; Doing Time
programme.desc: SpongeBob finds the secret utility belt that Mermaid Man left behind at the Krusty Krab, unintentionally turns on the shrink ray and reduces everyone in his path to the size of action figures. They try to teach her how to resolve the problem peacefully, but Billy has other ideas. / When Darwin taunts Gumball about how predictable he is, Gumball tries to prove that he can still surprise his buddy. / Gumball and Darwin are devastated to learn that Mr. Robinson -- their favourite person in the world -- is selling his house and leaving town. / Mom and the kids depart for their hard day's work, leaving a seemingly lazy Dad half-asleep on the sofa. programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say `boots' prior to going on a whirlwind word adventure.

programme.title: Bing

programme.title: Patchwork Pals
programme.desc: The frog's singing upsets the rest of the patchwork animals.

programme.title: Numberblocks

programme.title: Let's Play
programme.desc: Rebecca discovers whether she has what it takes to be an ancient Roman as she helps builders Cementicus and Fabulous finish the Emperor's new villa.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around the World

programme.title: Get Well Soon
programme.sub-title: Get Well Soon Hospital: Plaster Cast
programme.desc: Visiting Dr Ranj at the Children's hospital today is Petal. Petal needs the cast on her arm changing because it has got dirty and is crumbling. Petal has a fractured arm. Dr Ranj shows her an x-ray of her fractured radius. She is going to have her plaster cast replaced with a fibre glass cast. Dr Ranj cuts off the plaster cast. Petal thinks her arm is thin and smelly but this is because she hasn't been able to wash it. Dr Ranj says Petal can choose the colour of her new cast. Petal picks her favourite colour, purple. Dr Ranj puts the new cast on Petal. She loves it and sings a song with Dr Ranj about taking care of your bones and wearing a cast. Petal then gets a special sticker for having being so good during her visit.(n)
